title: Introduction
text: Small quizes lectures can help gauge well students understood material. Commercial services exist, example Mentimeter. Mentimeter focused asking single questions rather batch questions, isn’t ideal making quiz. classquiz designed use google forms ask questions, google sheets store responses, observable download results google sheets, process plot lecture slides. services hosting forms results used instead.

title: Introduction
text: Make publish google form. following types question supported. multiple-choice grid (one per form) multiple-choice (several questions per form set answers) one type question allowed per form. google form save results google sheets. Share read access google sheet anyone link. Add question form quarto cq_add_form(). function displays URL provided iframe. Add results quiz quarto cq_add_results(). function makes set observable code chunks download data, process plot . need use type argument give type question. “multiple_choice_grid” currently properly supported. must use #| output: asis code block option generated observable chunks correctly interpreted. OJS Syntax Error (line 10, column 5)Unexpected token can customise appearance plots. height can changed height argument. Unless question text short, need increase leftMargin. domain gives possible responses, range specifies colours used.
code: ```{r} cq_add_form(   form_url = "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeLIUnzdTfBUqjr_X0MvF7JBDQgy_mndeZVsjgW4JR3tFRHSw/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=107915462972182704713" ) ``` ```{r} #| output: asis cq_add_results(   sheet_url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v3jF5jzbd4bpsmf1x-cZpX1NmL4FAsR0tGIh-a5I_RU/edit?resourcekey=&gid=24040024#gid=24040024",    type = "multiple_choice_grid" ) ``` import { aq, op } from '@uwdata/arquero'  getCsvUrl = url => {   url = new URL(url);   const id = url.pathname.split('/')[3]   const gid = new URLSearchParams(url.hash.slice(1)).get('gid') || 0;   return `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/${id}/export?format=csv&gid=${gid}` } url_1 = 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v3jF5jzbd4bpsmf1x-cZpX1NmL4FAsR0tGIh-a5I_RU/edit?resourcekey=&gid=24040024#gid=24040024' data_1 = {   refresh_1;   yield(aq.loadCSV(getCsvUrl(url_1))) } cnames_1 = data_1                      .columnNames()                      .filter((c) => !['Timestamp', 'Score'].includes(c))                      .map(d => d.replace(/^.*\[/, '').replace(/]$/, '')); foldData_1 = data_1   .fold(aq.not('Timestamp', 'Score'), { as: ['question', 'answer'] })   .spread({question: d => op.split(d.question, '[')} , {as: ['question_title', 'question']})            .derive({question: d => op.replace(d.question, ']', '')}); ```{ojs} //| echo: false Plot.plot({   marginLeft: 100,    marginBottom: 60,      x: {label: 'Frequency', labelOffset: 50},   y: {label: null, domain: cnames_1},   color: {     legend: true,     ,        },   style: {fontSize: '25px'},   marks: [     Plot.barX(foldData_1, {y: 'question', x: 1, inset: 0.5, fill: 'answer', sort: 'answer'}),     Plot.ruleX([0])   ] }) ``` viewof refresh_1 = Inputs.button('Refresh') ```{r} #| output: asis  cq_add_results(   sheet_url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v3jF5jzbd4bpsmf1x-cZpX1NmL4FAsR0tGIh-a5I_RU/edit?resourcekey=&gid=24040024#gid=24040024",    type = "multiple_choice_grid",    height = 500,    marginLeft = 170,   domain = c("Yes", "No"),   range = c("green", "orange") ) ``` url_2 = 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v3jF5jzbd4bpsmf1x-cZpX1NmL4FAsR0tGIh-a5I_RU/edit?resourcekey=&gid=24040024#gid=24040024' data_2 = {   refresh_2;   yield(aq.loadCSV(getCsvUrl(url_2))) } cnames_2 = data_1                      .columnNames()                      .filter((c) => !['Timestamp', 'Score'].includes(c))                      .map(d => d.replace(/^.*\[/, '').replace(/]$/, '')); foldData_2 = data_2   .fold(aq.not('Timestamp', 'Score'), { as: ['question', 'answer'] })   .spread({question: d => op.split(d.question, '[')} , {as: ['question_title', 'question']})            .derive({question: d => op.replace(d.question, ']', '')}); Plot.plot({   marginLeft: 170,    marginBottom: 60,   height: 500,    x: {label: 'Frequency', labelOffset: 50},   y: {label: null, domain: cnames_2},   color: {     legend: true,     domain: ["Yes", "No"],     range: ["green", "orange"],   },   style: {fontSize: '25px'},   marks: [     Plot.barX(foldData_2, {y: 'question', x: 1, inset: 0.5, fill: 'answer', sort: 'answer'}),     Plot.ruleX([0])   ] }) viewof refresh_2 = Inputs.button('Refresh')
